hero.title: Plan Your First Visit
hero.subtitle: We're honored you're considering visiting Oatville Community Church. Here's everything you need to feel comfortable and confident.

whatToExpect.title: What to Expect
whatToExpect.description: Services blend traditional hymns, organ, and some contemporary elements in a reverent but welcoming atmosphere. Come as you are – there's no dress code. You'll be greeted warmly, never spotlighted.
highlights: Parking available on site – arrive 10 minutes early
Friendly greeters & ushers if you need help finding a seat
Prayer and community are central (opportunities to connect)

childrenFamilies.title: Children & Families
childrenFamilies.description: We love families. Nursery and children's ministry options are available during worship. You're welcome to keep your kids with you if you prefer; we support whatever helps your family worship best.

beforeYouArrive.title: Before You Arrive
steps: Stop by to say hello – we'd love to meet you
Complete a connect card if you'd like follow‑up

faqs.question: Do I need to dress up?
faqs.answer: Wear what's comfortable – jeans, casual, or traditional. All are welcome.

faqs.question: Will I be singled out?
faqs.answer: No – you're our guest. We won't ask you to stand or introduce yourself publicly.

faqs.question: Is the building accessible?
faqs.answer: Yes. Entrances and seating are accessible; let us know if you need assistance.

faqs.question: What about parking?
faqs.answer: Free parking is available on-site. We recommend arriving 10-15 minutes early to find a convenient spot.

faqs.question: Can I bring my children?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! We have nursery and children's ministry during services, or children are welcome to stay with parents.

faqs.question: What happens during a typical service?
faqs.answer: Services include worship music (traditional hymns and contemporary), prayer, biblical teaching, and fellowship time.

faqs.question: How can I get involved?
faqs.answer: Start by visiting! We have various ministries and volunteer opportunities. Talk to any greeter or staff member about ways to connect.

faqs.question: Do you offer communion?
faqs.answer: Yes, communion is offered regularly during our worship services as a time of remembrance and fellowship.

nextStep.title: Next Step
nextStep.description: Ready to visit? We'd love to greet you personally – or just come and enjoy.
